author: Travis Simpson (noreply@couriernews.com)
title: Little Johns shock No. 1 Warriors
text: DANVILLE — The Danville Little Johns ruined the Lamar Warriors perfect record on Friday at Little John Field — not by a little, by a lot.The Little Johns (5-3, 4-1 3A-4 Conference) outscored Lamar 40-15.The Warriors (7-1, 4-1) scored first on a 2-yard run by Dusty Wilkins. Blake Kern added the PAT to make it 7-0 with 9:07 in the first.Danville struck next with a 74-yard pass from Jake Madding to Jamey Holbrook to tie the score. Danville scored again — a 37-yard run by Holbrook with 48 seconds left in the first quarter to put the Little Johns up 13-7.Madding made it 20-7 early in the third quarter on a 62-yard run, and Chris Thurman made it 26-7 with 5:24 left in the third on a 25-yard carry.Lamar's Cody Wyatt returned the ensuing kickoff 54 yards for a touchdown. Wilkins added the 2-point conversion to make it 26-15.Holbrook added a 70-yard rushing touchdown with 4:39 left in the third. Holbrook took it 37 yards with 6:34 left in the game to make it 40-15.Danville will host Paris next week. Lamar will host Two Rivers.
